results.title: Save the soil
results.creator_credit: Raymond Evans and Division of Motion Pictures Extension Service
results.brief_description: A general discussion on the problem of soil conservation. Various ways in which soil can be conserved and protected are demonstrated, including: terracing; cover-cropping to prevent erosion; crop rotation; use of manures and commercial fertilizers.

results.title: Sarongs and silver
results.creator_credit: Zain Hussain and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: The ancient folk-crafts of silk weaving and silver work as practiced on the East Coast of Malaya. A picturesque wedding celebration sequence serves to display pieces of elaborately worked silver.

results.title: Sardinian project
results.creator_credit: Jack Chambers, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Shell Pet Company
results.brief_description: The incidence of malaria in Sardinia had become so high in 1946 that the Italian Government undertook a campaign to eradicate the malaria-bearing mosquito from the island. A special organization known as ERLAAS was set up and in 1947 an all-out effort was launched. All structures where the adult mosquito might be sheltering had to be sprayed with special emulsions. In an attempt to wipe out the larvae, every patch and pool of water was sprayed with DDT mixed with diesel oil, and marshy places were cleared and drained. By the end to 1948 the work was complete and as a result a new era in the life of the Sardinian people had begun.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Chambers, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Shell Pet Company

results.title: Sardinia
results.brief_description: In the centre of the Western Mediterranean the granite island of Sardinia is inhabited by a vigorous, resourceful race of people, struggling to wrest a livelihood from the inhospitable soil. Tuna fishing is the most productive industry. Ancient ceremonies and festivals are a feature of village life. Man’s adaptability to a rugged, rocky island environment is the broad theme of this story of an independent and self-reliant people who shun the ways of the modern world and cling to ancient customs and traditions whose origins are lost in time.

results.title: The Salt marsh: a question of values
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: For the survival of humanity, we have to recognise the limits of our exploitation of natural systems. This film documents the value of the botanical communities that exist between sea and land. Emphasises the importance of energy flow and food supply in marshes and estuaries.

results.title: The Salmon industry of British Columbia
results.brief_description: The film opens with a map of the fishing grounds of the world, and the waters of British Columbia are selected to show details of the large-scale salmon industry. A study of this extremely active and resourceful fish in its natural surroundings is always fascinating, and this film combines a clear exposition of fishing by seine net, and the preparation of the fish for the cannery.

results.title: Sailing for beginners
results.brief_description: Instruction on dinghy sailing. Describes the main parts of a boat and her rigging, and explains and demonstrates various manoeuvres including going about, beating to windward, running, gybing, sailing triangular and figure of eight courses, and picking up a man overboard. Slow motion and diagrams are used. Filmed at Burnham-on-Crouch with the cooperation of the Royal Corinthian Yacht Club.
